00031 /// @file xed-flags.h
00032 /// @author Mark Charney <mark.charney@intel.com>
00033 
00034 #ifndef _XED_FLAGS_H_
00035 # define  _XED_FLAGS_H_
00036 
00037 #include "xed-types.h"
00038 #include "xed-flag-enum.h"
00039 #include "xed-flag-action-enum.h"
00040 
00041 
00042 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00044 /// a union of flags bits
00045 union  XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_flag_set_s {
00046     struct {
00047         xed_uint32_t of:1;
00048         xed_uint32_t sf:1;
00049         xed_uint32_t zf:1;
00050         xed_uint32_t af:1;
00051         xed_uint32_t pf:1;
00052         xed_uint32_t cf:1;
00053         xed_uint32_t df:1;
00054         xed_uint32_t vif:1;
00055         xed_uint32_t iopl:1;
00056         xed_uint32_t _if:1;  ///< underscore to avoid token clash
00057         xed_uint32_t ac:1;
00058         xed_uint32_t vm:1;
00059         xed_uint32_t rf:1;
00060         xed_uint32_t nt:1;
00061         xed_uint32_t tf:1;
00062         xed_uint32_t id:1;
00063         xed_uint32_t vip:1; 
00064         xed_uint32_t fc0:1;  ///< x87 flag FC0
00065         xed_uint32_t fc1:1;  ///< x87 flag FC1
00066         xed_uint32_t fc2:1;  ///< x87 flag FC2
00067         xed_uint32_t fc3:1;  ///< x87 flag FC3
00068     } s;
00069     xed_uint32_t flat;
00070 };
00071 
00072 typedef union xed_flag_set_s xed_flag_set_t;
00073 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00074 /// @name Flag-set accessors
00075 //@{
00076 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00077 /// print the flag set in the supplied buffer
00078 XED_DLL_EXPORT int  xed_flag_set_print(const xed_flag_set_t* p, char* buf, int buflen);
00079 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00080 /// returns true if this object has a subset of the flags of the
00081 /// "other" object.
00082 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_flag_set_is_subset_of(const xed_flag_set_t* p,
00083                                const xed_flag_set_t* other);
00084 //@}
00085 
00086 
00087 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00088 
00089 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00090 /// Associated with each flag field there can be one action.
00091 typedef struct XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_flag_enum_s {
00092     xed_flag_enum_t flag;
00093     // there are at most two actions per flag. The 2nd may be invalid.
00094     xed_flag_action_enum_t action;
00095 }  xed_flag_action_t;
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099 
00100 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00101 /// @name Lowest-level flag-action accessors
00102 //@{
00103 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00104 /// get the name of the flag
00105 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_flag_enum_t
00106 xed_flag_action_get_flag_name(const xed_flag_action_t* p);
00107 /// @ingroup FLAGS        
00108 /// return the action
00109 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_flag_action_enum_t
00110 xed_flag_action_get_action(const xed_flag_action_t* p, unsigned int i);
00111 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00112 /// returns true if the specified action is invalid. Only the 2nd flag might be invalid.
00113 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t 
00114 xed_flag_action_action_invalid(const xed_flag_action_enum_t a);
00115 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00116 /// print the flag & actions
00117 XED_DLL_EXPORT int xed_flag_action_print(const xed_flag_action_t* p, char* buf, int buflen);
00118 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00119 /// returns true if either action is a read
00120 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t 
00121 xed_flag_action_read_flag(const xed_flag_action_t* p );
00122 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00123 /// returns true if either action is a write
00124 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t 
00125 xed_flag_action_writes_flag(const xed_flag_action_t* p);
00126   
00127 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00128 /// test to see if the specific action is a read 
00129 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t 
00130 xed_flag_action_read_action( xed_flag_action_enum_t a);
00131 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00132 /// test to see if a specific action is a write
00133 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t 
00134 xed_flag_action_write_action( xed_flag_action_enum_t a);
00135 //@}
00136 
00137 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00138 
00139 #define XED_MAX_FLAG_ACTIONS (XED_FLAG_LAST + 3)
00140 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00141 /// A collection of #xed_flag_action_t's and unions of read and written flags
00142 typedef struct  XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_simple_flag_s 
00143 {
00144     xed_uint8_t nflags;
00145 
00146     xed_bool_t may_write :1;
00147     xed_bool_t must_write :1;
00148 
00149     /// indexed from 0, not by position in archtectural flags array.
00150     xed_flag_action_t fa[XED_MAX_FLAG_ACTIONS];
00151 
00152     ///union of read flags
00153     xed_flag_set_t read;
00154 
00155     /// union of written flags (includes undefined flags);
00156     xed_flag_set_t written;
00157 
00158     /// union of undefined flags;
00159     xed_flag_set_t undefined;
00160 } xed_simple_flag_t;
00161 
00162 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00163 /// @name Accessing the simple flags (Mid-level access)
00164 //@{
00165 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00166 /// returns the number of flag-actions
00167 XED_DLL_EXPORT unsigned int 
00168 xed_simple_flag_get_nflags(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00169 
00170 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00171 /// return union of bits for read flags
00172 XED_DLL_EXPORT const xed_flag_set_t* 
00173 xed_simple_flag_get_read_flag_set(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00174 
00175 /// @ingroup FLAGS  
00176 /// return union of bits for written flags
00177 XED_DLL_EXPORT const xed_flag_set_t*
00178 xed_simple_flag_get_written_flag_set(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00179 
00180 
00181 /// @ingroup FLAGS  
00182 /// return union of bits for undefined flags
00183 XED_DLL_EXPORT const xed_flag_set_t*
00184 xed_simple_flag_get_undefined_flag_set(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00185 
00186 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00187 /// Indicates the flags are only conditionally written. Usally MAY-writes
00188 /// of the flags instructions that are dependent on a REP count.
00189 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_simple_flag_get_may_write(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00190 
00191 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00192 /// the flags always written
00193 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_simple_flag_get_must_write(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00194 
00195 /// @ingroup FLAGS
00196 /// return the specific flag-action. Very detailed low level information
00197 XED_DLL_EXPORT const xed_flag_action_t*
00198 xed_simple_flag_get_flag_action(const xed_simple_flag_t* p, unsigned int i);
00199 
00200 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00201 /// boolean test to see if flags are read, scans the flags
00202 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t
00203 xed_simple_flag_reads_flags(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00204 
00205 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00206 /// boolean test to see if flags are written, scans the flags
00207 XED_DLL_EXPORT xed_bool_t xed_simple_flag_writes_flags(const xed_simple_flag_t* p);
00208 
00209 /// @ingroup FLAGS    
00210 /// print the flags
00211 XED_DLL_EXPORT int xed_simple_flag_print(const xed_simple_flag_t* p, char* buf, int buflen);
00212 //@}
00213

00219 #endif
